description: What you should know if you have exceeded the maximum journey time on a TfL journey.

texts: {"template":"intro","texts":["You could be charged two maximum fares if your journey takes too long. You may get a refund."],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
When you use contactless or Oyster to pay as you go, there is a maximum amount of time that you can spend making a single journey on Tube, DLR, London Overground, TfL Rail and National Rail.
If you spend longer than the maximum journey time for your journey, you could be charged 2 maximum fares.
Please wait at least 48 hours as you might receive an automatic refund:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["\u003cstrong\u003eOyster\u003c/strong\u003e - we'll automatically add it to your card the next time you touch in or out of a rail journey","\u003cstrong\u003eContactless\u003c/strong\u003e - the refund will show on your next card statement, or we will adjust the fares charged when you next travel"]}
If you do not get an automatic refund, you have up to 8 weeks from your journey to claim.
We will not give a refund if you have already claimed 3 maximum fare refunds in the same calendar month.
